summary: Verified dark glassmorphism theme consistency across all UI components. All dropdown menus (Call Type, Voice Model, Caller ID, OTP Digits) now display with dark purple background (rgba(15, 10, 30, 0.98)) instead of white. The fix using CSS injection via useEffect in AppWrapper component is working correctly.
passed_tests: Login page - dark glassmorphism theme with purple gradient background
Login form - glass card effect with proper contrast
Admin Dashboard - stat cards with glass effect and neon glow
Admin Users tab - glass table with proper styling
Admin Invite Codes tab - consistent dark theme
Admin Providers tab - SignalWire and Infobip cards with glass effect
User Panel - Voice Bot Control header with proper styling
Call Type dropdown - dark purple background (rgba(15, 10, 30, 0.98))
Voice Model dropdown - dark purple background with all options visible
Caller ID dropdown - dark purple background, filters by provider
OTP Digits dropdown - dark purple background with 4-8 options
Channel tabs (CH 1, CH 2) - neon glow effect on selection
Call Steps tabs (S1, S2, S3, ACCEPT, RETRY) - purple glassmorphism styling
critical_code_review_comments: CSS injection approach in App.js useEffect is effective for Radix UI Portal elements
Multiple layers of dark theme styling (index.css, App.css, select.jsx, App.js) provide redundancy
All dropdowns confirmed to have dark background with proper text contrast
context_for_next_testing_agent: Dark glassmorphism theme is fully consistent across all pages. Dropdown menus fixed via CSS injection in App.js useEffect. All Select components use dark purple background (rgba(15, 10, 30, 0.98)) with blur effect and purple border. Provider switching (CH 1/CH 2) correctly updates Caller ID dropdown with provider-specific phone numbers.

mocked_apis.SignalWire voice API: Account suspended - calls use simulation mode
mocked_apis.Infobip calls API: Configuration blocked - calls use simulation mode
